meta.subtitle: The Tzemach Tzedek · Derech Mitzvosecha

blocks.text: עַל כֵּן לֹא יֹאכְלוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת גִּיד הַנָּשֶׁה

blocks.label: Ein Sof & the Sefirot
blocks.english: The Infinite One · Ten Divine Attributes
blocks.tagline: God is utterly infinite and simple — "He is not defined by any attribute whatsoever." Yet He emanated ten ספירות to guide the worlds, uniting with them completely: "He and His vessels are one."

details.title: Why Sefirot Exist
details.content: The infinite God cannot directly sustain finite creation. The Sefirot serve as intermediary Kelim (vessels) through which His light is stepped down and channeled — yet He unites with them completely.

details.title: The Three Divisions
details.content: חב"ד (intellect) = Head · חג"ת (emotions) = Torso · נה"י (action) = Legs. These form the structure of Zeir Anpin, with which Jacob's soul corresponds.

details.title: Each Contains Ten
details.content: Every Sefirah contains all ten within itself! Chesed has Chochmah-of-Chesed, Chesed-of-Chesed, Netzach-of-Chesed, etc. This creates a "head," "torso," and "end" within each single attribute.

blocks.label: The Body — Inner Attributes
blocks.tagline: The "torso" of the Sefirot — the core emotional attributes. These are called "inside the body" because they operate with עונג (pleasure), expressing the soul's inner self.

details.title: Chabad of the Attribute
details.content: When kindness flows from an intellectual reason — loving someone because of some understanding of their worth. There's pleasure in the comprehension itself. This is the "head" of Chesed.

details.title: Chesed of Chesed
details.content: When kindness flows from innate nature — giving simply because that's who you are. Abraham gave even to idol worshippers. There's pleasure in the act of giving itself. This is the "torso" of Chesed.

details.title: Why Pleasure Matters
details.content: אין למעלה מן העונג — "There is nothing higher than pleasure." Pleasure indicates the inner self is invested. When pleasure is present, the soul's essence shines through the action.

details.title: Protected from Attack
details.content: The angel couldn't touch Jacob's "body" — the inner attributes illuminated by Supernal Pleasure (Atik Yomin). The inner light itself provides protection.

blocks.label: The Thighs — Outside the Body
blocks.tagline: The "legs" of the Sefirot — Netzach (Victory) and Hod (Acknowledgment). These are called "outside the body" because they operate בלי עונג — through determination alone, without inner pleasure.

details.title: Netzach of Chesed
details.content: When kindness flows through victory and conquest — forcing oneself to give despite no love, no natural inclination, and no intellectual reason. Pure will overcoming all resistance.

details.title: Aravei Nachal — No Taste or Smell
details.content: Netzach and Hod are compared to ערבי נחל (willows) — which have neither taste nor fragrance. Taste and fragrance symbolize pleasure and inner meaning. Netzach operates without these.

details.title: Why Vulnerable
details.content: Without the inner light of pleasure, Netzach lacks the protection that comes from Divine illumination. The "Mochin" (intellectual light) have withdrawn, leaving only bare will without understanding.

details.title: The Angel's Target
details.content: וירא כי לא יכול לו ויגע בכף ירכו — "He saw he could not prevail, so he touched the socket of his thigh." The angel attacked the only vulnerable point.

items.detail: Kindness because of a reason — understanding why the person deserves it. Pleasure in comprehension. The wisdom that motivates the emotion.
Kindness as natural disposition — giving because that's who you are. Pleasure in the act itself. Abraham's kindness to all, even idol worshippers.
Kindness through conquest — forcing oneself despite no love or reason. No pleasure — pure will. The vulnerable outer dimension.

blocks.label: Back to Back — The Vulnerable State
blocks.tagline: When Z"A and Malchut unite "back to back," only the outer dimensions connect. The mind rules the heart externally — the heart submits but isn't transformed. This state is necessary for creation, but leaves an opening for attack.

details.title: The Desert State
details.content: Between Egypt and the Land — the person has left spiritual bondage but hasn't arrived at transformation. They understand intellectually but the heart still wants worldly things. Service through effort, not delight.

details.title: Why Necessary for Creation
details.content: אין מלך בלא עם — "No king without a nation." For creatures to experience themselves as separate beings, Divine light must be concealed. Back to back creates this concealment.

details.title: The Arizal's Teaching
details.content: "Had they been face to face, the external forces would not have prevailed." The blemish occurred specifically because of the back-to-back positioning — Netzach of Z"A aligned with Hod of Malkhut.

details.title: Opening for Attack
details.content: In back-to-back, the "prosecuting" forces can claim Israel doesn't deserve Divine flow. Without the inner light flowing, there's no nullification of opposition.

blocks.label: Face to Face — Complete Union
blocks.tagline: When the mind's understanding penetrates the heart's inner essence. The person truly delights in Godliness — not forcing compliance, but genuine transformation. It'hafcha — the heart itself is changed.

details.title: The Land of Israel
details.content: "A good and spacious land" — expanded consciousness (Gadlut). Here the person has real knowledge (Da'at) of God. The heart doesn't just comply; it genuinely חפץ (desires) holiness.

details.title: Protected State
details.content: Against someone in face-to-face — whose heart genuinely delights in Godliness — Amalek has no power. The inner light nullifies all opposition automatically.

details.title: Mochin d'Gadlut
details.content: "Mature consciousness" is the source of mercy. A mature adult can understand and accommodate perspectives beyond their own. Greater wisdom creates greater capacity for mercy.

details.title: The Goal
details.content: The progression from back-to-back to face-to-face is the entire spiritual journey. Our service below awakens corresponding realities above — באתערותא דלתתא אתערותא דלעילא.

blocks.label: Amalek — Brazen Defiance
blocks.hebrew: עמלק / יודע רבו ומתכוון למרוד בו
blocks.english: Amalek · Knows His Master and Intentionally Rebels
blocks.tagline: Amalek is not concealment — he knows the truth and defies it anyway. "Kingship without a crown" — claiming authority with no justification. He attacks the connection between mind and heart, severing הדעת.

details.title: Different from Regular Sin
details.content: Most spiritual obstacles work through concealment — a "spirit of folly" that makes one forget the truth. Amalek witnessed the miracles and attacks anyway! Brazen, irrational defiance.

details.title: Target: The Stiff Neck
details.content: Jews are "stiff-necked" — the neck (connection between head and heart) is strong. Even when the heart wants otherwise, it follows clear truth. Amalek attacks this very connection.

details.title: The Weak Ones at the Rear
details.content: ויזנב בך כל הנחשלים אחריך — those in "back to back" state, where mind rules heart but hasn't transformed it. Against genuine face-to-face delight, Amalek has no power.

details.title: From Generation to Generation
details.content: מלחמה לה׳ בעמלק מדר דר — "God's war against Amalek from dor dor." Wherever there's a back-to-back transmission from higher to lower, Amalek fights to sever it.

blocks.text: Contrast: Face to Face vs. Back to Back

rows.panim: Inner of upper → inner of lower
rows.achor: Outer of upper → outer of lower

blocks.title: The Gid Hanashe — Matter Reflects Spirit
blocks.intro: "The lower world is patterned after the upper world." Every physical reality has a spiritual root — and the sciatic nerve reflects the cosmic truth of Netzach.

items.content: The sciatic nerve in animals corresponds to Netzach above — "outside the body." Since a blemish occurred in the supernal "thigh," it's reflected in the physical thighs of animals.
"There is no taste-giving quality in sinews" — the gid hanashe is tasteless, "like wood." This reflects the spiritual reality: Netzach has no "taste" — no revealed inner pleasure.
The letters א"ת hint to Tisha B'Av (ט"ב = א"ת in gematria). This sinew's kelipah holds sway on Tisha B'Av. Netzach builds Jerusalem; its blemish = Temple destruction.
"And the sun shone for him" — Jacob was healed by the rising sun. This foreshadows the future redemption when the "sun of righteousness" will shine with complete healing.

blocks.outro: By refraining from eating the gid hanashe, we acknowledge the cosmic wound — while our determined service hastens its complete healing.

items.detail: The person believes in God but only with abstract faith. The emotions are trapped in worldly desires. "The people believed" — but the heart hasn't moved.
The person has left Egypt but hasn't reached the Land. Tevunah — understanding that rules the heart externally. Back to back. Amalek attacks here.
"A good and spacious land" — expanded consciousness. Da'at — true knowledge. The heart is transformed, genuinely delighting in holiness. Face to face.

blocks.content:
The prohibition of גיד הנשה is far more than a dietary restriction — it's a window into the very structure of Divine service and cosmic history.

The Sefirot are arranged in "head, torso, and end" — with Netzach belonging to the "end," the part "outside the body" where inner pleasure isn't revealed. This makes Netzach vulnerable to attack, because it operates through will and determination rather than illuminated understanding.

The angel struck there, and the blemish reverberates through history: in the cessation of prophecy, in the destruction of Jerusalem, in every Jew's struggle to translate knowledge into living reality. Amalek exploits this vulnerability, attacking wherever the connection between higher and lower is merely external.

But the repair also comes through us. When we persist in service despite not "feeling" it — when we study "more than usual" — we create connection above and prevent the cosmic severance. Our determined effort, even without delight, has supreme value.

ויזרח לו השמש — "And the sun shone for him." Just as Jacob was healed by the rising sun, so too will the Jewish people be healed when the ultimate Sun rises. The blemish in Netzach will be completely rectified. Jerusalem will be rebuilt. And the taste that was never in this sinew will be revealed as infinite sweetness.
